results.title: The Long kiss goodnight (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Renny Harlin, Shane Black, Stephanie Austin, Forge and Steve Tisch
results.brief_description: Samantha Cain (Geena Davis) is a school teacher who for the past 8 years has suffered amnesia. Haunted by bizarre flashbacks, she hires private detective Mitch (Samuel L. Jackson), to discover her true identity. They discover that Samantha is actually a lethal government assassin, presumed dead and that’s the way the authorities would like to keep it. Samantha is now hunted by her past and a string of government agents who have placed a contract on her life and kidnapped her daughter.

results.title: Yol
results.creator_credit: Serif Goren, Yilmaz Guney, Edi Hubschmid, Cactus Films, DRS, Films A2, Guney Film, Maran Film and Schweizer Fernselen
results.brief_description: Five political prisoners are given one week’s reprieve to go and visit their families. One man returns to find that his adulterous wife is being kept prisoner by his father-in-law who expects him to kill her. Another returns to his village but cannot marry the woman he loves because custom decrees he must marry his widowed sister-in-law; another finds his family has shunned him for confessing to the authorities. As the men spread out across Turkey’s vast terrain, “Yol” explores the strictures of tradition on family and on marriage. The men, all of whom must return to their prison cells, are prisoners of an authoritarian state. Their women and their children are prisoners of an equally authoritarian patriarchy. Guney was himself a political prisoner, incarcerated for his intellectual activism against state militarism, when he wrote the script to “Yol”, which was smuggled out to Serif Goren, who directed the film for Guney. Guney escaped to Switzerland where he completed the film. Though the social, political and gender relationships explored in the film are harsh and unrelenting, what is transcendant about “Yol” is the deeply rigorous humanism that Guney and Goren extend to all their characters. That Guney and Goren were able to complete the film is a testament itself to their intelligence and dedication to a cinema of enlightenment. This film is one of cinema’s greatest laments against the violence of patriarchy and one of the great emancipist works about the possibilities of change and transformation. (Awards: Winner of the Palme d’Or at Cannes. Winner of the International Critic’s Prize) In Turkish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Mummy
results.creator_credit: Stephen Sommers, James Jacks, Patricia Carr, Sean Daniel and Alphaville Productions
results.brief_description: Loosely adapted from the classic 1932 horror film starring Boris Karloff, this version is set in Egypt, where over 3,000 years ago the high priest Imhotep (Arnold Vosloo) was given the all-important assignment of preparing the recently dead for their journey into the afterlife. However he made one fatal mistake - he became smitten with Anck-Su-Namun, the mistress of the Pharaoh. Driven mad by jealousy and love, Imhotep murdered the Pharaoh, and his punishment was to be buried alive and suffer the torment of an eternal life in his wretched tomb. In 1925, a band of adventurers seeking fame and fortune - led by Rick O’Connell (Brendan Fraser), an American expatriate who has joined the foreign legion, and Evelyn Carnarvon (Rachel Weisz), an amateur archaeologist - find a previously unknown burial site in Egypt. The team starts to dig, hoping to find lost riches but instead they disturb the tomb of Imhotep, causing him to rise from the grave to wreak vengeance on humanity.

results.title: Logan's run
results.creator_credit: Michael Anderson, Saul David and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Welcome to the 23rd Century, a perfect world of total pleasure. The only thing you can’t have is your 30th birthday. On Lastday, senior citizens must go through the ritual of “renewal” where a fiery carousel spins them into oblivion. Michael York is Logan, a loyal citizen whose job is to seek and destroy “runners”, sceptics who seek to escape the ceremonial execution. Fast approaching his own time of renewal, he becomes a runner in order to seek refuge from his hedonistic, automated world. Based on the novel “Logans run” by William F. Nolan, this classic science fiction film, distinguished by awesome spectacle, won an Academy Award for Best Special Effects and was the first film to use laser beam holography.

results.title: Very Annie Mary
results.creator_credit: Sara Sugarman, Damian Jones, Graham Broadbent, Arts Council of Great Britain, Arts Council of Wales, Film Four International and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: Annie Mary (Rachel Griffiths) is a simple-minded, clumsy, and kind-hearted twenty-something still living at home with her domineering, hypocritical, Pavarotti loving father in a small country town. Denied the chance to study singing in Milan at age sixteen due to the death of her mother, Annie has given up singing altogether and is barely hanging onto dregs of a dull romance with Colin, a man whom she has to bribe for sex. Just when it seems she may have a chance to have a life of her own, Annie Mary’s father has a stroke, and she is forced to take the reigns of his bakery and care for him at home. When Annie Mary realises that her best friend is dying, she desperately tries to raise money for a trip to Disneyland by forming a pop group and entering a talent contest, with one thousand pounds in prize money. A comedy of sorts, “Very Annie Mary” features several song and dance routines in the mode of “The Full Monty” and like that film, the depressed economy is the backdrop against which the townspeople hope to illicit a modicum of happiness from their penny pinching lives. Director Sara Sugarman is also responsible for the script.

results.title: George of the jungle
results.creator_credit: Sam Weisman, David Hoberman, Jon Avnet, Jordan Kerner, Mandeville Films and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the cartoon series, “George of the jungle” is an action/comedy version of the characters created by Jay Ward. George (Brendan Fraser) is lost to the jungle as a young boy and is subsequently raised by apes and other jungle creatures. As George grows to manhood it transpires that he is a brave but none too bright young man. An intrepid American woman, Ursula Stanhope, travels to the jungle to satisfy her longing for adventurous experiences. Stanhope’s snobbish boorish fiancee follows her to the jungle and becomes embroiled in a tug-of-war with George for Stanhopes’ affection. But can George leave his gentle animal family for the urban jungle of San Francisco? The comedy is broad and slapstick in style, with Fraser revelling in the pratfalls of the lead role. Also featuring the voice of John Cleese (as Ape the ape) and 1970s blaxploitation icon Richard Roundtree.

results.title: Unbreakable
results.creator_credit: M Night Shyamalan, Barry Mendel, Sam Mercer, Blinding Edge Pictures, Limited Edition Productions Inc. and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Unbreakable is the follow-up film for M. Night Shyamalan after his worldwide hit “The Sixth sense”. Bruce Willis stars as David Dunn, an everyman character, a security guard and father of one, whose marriage is undergoing a crisis. David is the only survivor of a horrific train crash and miraculously is completely unharmed. Just after the crash David is befriended by Elijah Price aka Mr Glass (Samuel L. Jackson), a man suffering from the opposite syndrome - he is as fragile as cotton wool and has spent his entire life recovering from broken bones. Price runs a comic book store specialising in original comic book cells and has a genuine belief that superheroes exist in real life. These two men of opposing physical make-ups are brought together and discover that their destinies are strangely linked. David slowly comes to realise that he has extrasensory powers and superhuman strength that render him unbreakable. “Unbreakable” is a thriller, a classic good versus evil tale that explores the notion of supernatural forces at work in the world. Cast also includes Robin Wright Penn.

results.title: Gravesend
results.creator_credit: Salvatore Stabile and Island Digital Media
results.brief_description: 22 year old filmmaker Salvatore Stabile’s debut feature owes a lot to Martin Scorsese’s gritty urban drama ‘Mean Streets’. Like that film, ‘Gravesend’ evokes a particular Brooklyn neighbourhood, painting a bleak picture of disenfranchised youth, aggressive masculinity and seething violence amongst the Italian American community. The film’s straight forward plot revolves around four friends whose usually uneventful Saturday night spins out of control when a member of the group accidentally shoots and kills someone. Their attempts to dispose of the body leads them into a bloody chain of events with inevitable tragic consequences. Cast includes Tony Tucci, Michael Parducci, Thomas Brandise and Tom Malloy.

results.title: Frida
results.creator_credit: Julie Taymor, Joy Polstein, Lindsay Flickinger, Lizz Speed, Nancy Hardin, Roberto Sneider, Salma Hayek, Sarah Green, Miramax Films and Ventanarosa Productions
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years, as we watch Frida’s journey to become a recognised artist in her own right.

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Julie Taymor, Joy Polstein, Lindsay Flickinger, Lizz Speed, Nancy Hardin, Roberto Sneider, Salma Hayek, Sarah Green, Miramax Films and Ventanarosa Productions
results.description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, played by Salma Hayek. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years and follows through to the moment of her death. We witness her struggles in life against traditional society’s perceptions of women, her own physical disabilities and most importantly, her struggle to become a recognised artist/painter in her own right. Cast includs Alfred Molina as Diego Rivera, Antonio Banderas, Valeria Golino, Ashley Judd, Mia Maestro, Edward Norton and Geoffrey Rush. Second disc contains many special features.

results.title: Unidentified flying oddball
results.creator_credit: Russ Mayberry, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Mark Twain’s ‘A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court’ this Disney film version provides a new twist to the story by setting it in today’s space age. NASA scientist Tom Trimble (Dennis Dugan) and his robot clone accidentally find themselves travelling back in time to the land of merry England and the court of King Arthur (Kenneth More). Here Trimble encounters the lovely Alisande (Sheila White), King Arthur’s enemy the evil knight Sir Mordred (Jim Dale), and Merlin (Ron Moody) the Court’s magician. Will Trimble be drawn into Sir Mordred’s evil plot to oust King Arthur or will he save the day and in doing so stop history from being changed forever? Cast includes John Le Mesurier as Sir Gawain.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Russ Mayberry, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.description: Based on Mark Twain’s ‘A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court’ this Disney film version provides a new twist to the story by setting it in today’s space age. NASA scientist Tom Trimble (Dennis Dugan) and his robot clone accidentally find themselves travelling back in time to the land of merry England and the court of King Arthur (Kenneth More). Here Trimble encounters the lovely Alisande (Sheila White), King Arthur’s enemy the evil knight Sir Mordred (Jim Dale), and Merlin (Ron Moody) the Court’s magician. Will Trimble be drawn into Sir Mordred’s evil plot to oust King Arthur or will he save the day and in doing so stop history from being changed forever? Cast includes John Le Mesurier as Sir Gawain.
